sections.title: A. Releasing Potential
sections.description: This includes spotting talent, enthusiasm, and resilience, 'learning by doing', training and research skill use in practice. It also covers understanding the importance of an enabling environment, facilitating and supporting research careers from the start.

fields.name: releasing_potential
fields.label: Your point of view on releasing potential:
fields.description: Rate the following statements from 0 to 4 (0 Not yet planned; 1 Planned; 2 Early progress; 3 Substantial Progress; 4 Established). Answer 0 if you don't know or the question is irrelevant. There is a comment box at the bottom for detailed responses.
sublabels: A1. Our organisation has a system to talent spot and support individuals who are active in-service development/quality improvement (QI) to progress on to research
A2. Our organisation has research role models and named nursing research leaders
A3. Our organisation identifies and celebrates success in the nursing research related activity
A4. Our organisation provides research advice sessions where nurses can explore ideas for project development
A5. Our organisation provides help to nurses to navigate research funding submissions, ethics and governance systems
A6. Our organisation  has a finance department that can cost research project involvement for external funding applications
A7. Our organisation has an active research-related mentorship programme
A8. Our organisation provides mentorship to nurses to successfully apply for internships and fellowship opportunities
A9. Our organisation enables the use of awarded grant funding in the manner intended (for example, protected time and spending decisions)

A10. Our organisation provides nurses with access to research learning opportunities to develop research skills delivered through our R&D department, service development, education, or training departments
A11. Our organisation provides nurses with access to experts who can advise on developing project proposals
A12. Our organisation has a mission statement that includes an ambition to do research as a core activity
A13. Our organisation has a strategic document to support research capacity development for nursing
A14. Our organisation has a research capacity delivery plan which aims to maximise the use, delivery, collaboration and leadership in nursing research
A15. Our organisation has a dedicated database of projects that are nurse led or where nurses have contributed
A16. Our organisation monitors research supervision and successful project development and delivery
A17. Our organisation develops good news stories of research in our internal and external communications
A18. Our organisation includes research in our induction process
A19. Our organisation offers pre-registration research placement opportunities
A20. Our organisation offers continuing professional development in research
A21. Our organisation provides opportunities to use research skills and experience of leadership at post-masters
A22. Our organisation provides opportunities to use research skills and experience of leadership at post-doctoral levels.

fields.name: releasing_potential_comments
fields.label: A23. If you would like to add any comments with regards to any of the statements in section above (Releasing Potential), please write below.

sections.title: B. Embedding Research
sections.description: This includes reducing barriers to research related activities by providing time and resources. It covers making research legitimate in the organisation, recognising the impact of research and nurses' contribution to research.

fields.name: embedding_research
fields.label: Your point of view on embedding research:
fields.description: Rate the following statements from 0 to 4 (0 Not yet planned; 1 Planned; 2 Early progress; 3 Substantial Progress; 4 Established). Answer 0 if you don't know or the question is irrelevant. There is a comment box at the bottom for detailed responses.
sublabels: B1. Our organisation  provides protected time for clinical nurses to support research related activities
B2. Our organisation provides resources (for example, time and/or funds) to support Public and Patient Involvement and Engagement to identify and develop research
B3. Our organisation develops impact stories from projects where nurses support, participate or lead research
B4. Our organisation collects case studies of where Public and Patient Involvement and Engagement has made a difference to research
B5. Our organisation actively communicates to the nursing workforce, clinical managers and executive team about how the involvement of nurses in research has made a difference to services and people

fields.name: embedding_research_comments
fields.label: B6. If you would like to add any comments with regards to any of the statements in the section above (Embedding Research), please write below.

sections.title: C. Linkages and Leadership
sections.description: This includes activities related to forming research links outside the organisation, promoting research leadership to influence the wider research agenda.

fields.name: linkages_and_leadership
fields.label: Your point of view on linkages and leadership:
fields.description: Rate the following statements from 0 to 4 (0 Not yet planned; 1 Planned; 2 Early progress; 3 Substantial Progress; 4 Established). Answer 0 if you don't know or the question is irrelevant. There is a comment box at the bottom for detailed responses.
sublabels: C1. Our organisation take part in research leadership and advisory activities outside our organisation (for example, sitting on ethics committees; funding committees; editorial boards and reviewing papers)
C2. Our organisation take part in research leadership and advisory activities outside organisations
C3. Our organisation work with professional bodies and national and regional policy structures to influence the research agenda
C4. Our organisation are members of forums outside our organisation which support research activity

fields.label: C5. If you would like to add any comments with regards to any of the statements in the section above (Linkages and Leadership), please write below.

sections.description: This includes activities related supporting the public and patientâ€™s involvement in research. It also covers engaging the wider nursing workforce in delivering portfolio research, creating more opportunities to deliver research and making the contribution of nurses visible.

fields.name: inclusive_research_delivery
fields.label: Your point of view on inclusive research delivery:
fields.description: Rate the following statements from 0 to 4 (0 Not yet planned; 1 Planned; 2 Early progress; 3 Substantial Progress; 4 Established). Answer 0 if you don't know or the question is irrelevant. There is a comment box at the bottom for detailed responses.

sections.title: E. Digital enabled research
sections.description: It covers activities related to research leadership and skills in digital technologies and data science including the skills needed to undertake research and service developments.

fields.name: digital_enabled_research
fields.label: Your point of view on digital enabled research:
fields.description: Rate the following statements from 0 to 4 (0 Not yet planned; 1 Planned; 2 Early progress; 3 Substantial Progress; 4 Established). Answer 0 if you don't know or the question is irrelevant. There is a comment box at the bottom for detailed responses.
sublabels: E1. Our organisation provides training for nurses to enable them to practise effectively in a digitally enabled environment
E2. Our organisation trains nurses to use and interpret data to make improvements to care (using audit, service evaluation or research)
E3. Our organisation  has digital nurse leaders in place who can provide advice and guidance in the use of digital technology in service development
E4. Our organisation has digital nurse leaders in place who can provide advice and guidance in the use of digital technology in research
E5. Our organisation has the infrastructure to support visualisation of data using business intelligence tools
E6. Our organisation has the internal structures that facilitate, support and enable nurse-led digital innovation
E7. Our organisation has effective partnerships with technology suppliers to support digital developments and innovation that meet the needs of nurses
E8. Our organisation collects and shares case study examples of improvements to care using digital technology
E9. Our organisation collects and shares case study examples of improvements to research using digital technology
